conclusion: Two parallel guide-rails are separated by distance l, with a fixed resistor R connected between b and d.
Conductor rod MN is placed on ab and cd, perpendicular to ab, with resistance R.
Device is in a uniform magnetic field with intensity B, perpendicular to the plane of the guide-rails.
Force applied to MN makes it move uniformly along the guide-rails at speed v.
The magnitude of the voltage U across MN is Blv.
The direction of the induced current flowing through the fixed resistor R is from a to b and from d to c.
